result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Joseph Foat

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: ERROR - PRELIMINARY HEARING IS NOT WAIVED

9:32 AM Defendant Anthony Joseph Foat in court.  Attorney Gabriel Pollak (Special Appearance) in court.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.  Through Counsel, DEF enters NG Plea to Counts 2 and 3.  Attny Pollak indicates DEF qualifies for PD appointment, Waives time limits for preliminary hearing and set for status conference.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on November 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

FOAT, ANTHONY J    CASE:  22082803

OWI 4th
OAR
IID Tampering/Fail to install
Bail/bond hearing on August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:15 AM DE  Anthony Foat in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Pollak (special appearance).  Kenneth Sortedahl  appeared by video for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE does qualify for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Pollak argues bond/No objection.  Court sets bond.   Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for September 20, 2022 at 8:30AM.  

SIBS  $1500   ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
